summary: Adds carriages to the minor cities.
descriptionHtml:
[img]http://i1241.photobucket.com/albums/gg510/Krucify77/SC.png[/img]




[color=#ff0000][b][center]﻿[/center]
 


[youtube]Uo-Xc-eQLSo[/youtube]





Please read the Known issues below.[/b][/color]
[color=#b45f06][size=4]

Description[/size][/color]

This mod adds carriages to the minor cities throughout Skyrim. When Hearthfire added the ability to travel to the smaller towns it was a nice addition. However, it only works from the Hearthfire homes. I added the ability to travel from these towns listed below and the ability to travel to your Hearthfire homes from these locations.


Travel to 
Darkwater Crossing
Dawnstar
Dragon Bridge
Falkreath
Heljarchen Hall
Ivarstead
Karthwasten
Kynesgrove
Lakeview Manor
Morthal
Old Hroldan
Riverwood
Rorikstead
Shor's Stone
Stonehills
Windstad Manor
Winterhold

Hearthfire and No Hearthfire editions available.
[font=Verdana][color=#333333][size=2]
[/size][/color][color=#ff0000][size=5]The reason i made this mod was i wanted a fully functional carriage system that uses less scripts. My main goal was to keep it lightweight and use as little scripts as possible compared to other options.

[/size][/color][/font]I did not touch the gold cost to travel. I realize it cost 50g to go from Windhelm to Kynesgrove, but then it only cost 20g from Windhelm to Markarth. No, it doesn't make sense, but that is the way Bethesda did it. I may at a later point do a more dynamic travel cost, and of course it will be script free.



[color=#a05722][size=4]Known Issues[/size][/color]

[b]It is recommended to start a new game if you want to use this mod. When i say new game i don't mean a save at Helgen or after Helgen. I mean hitting the "New Game Button" in the menu. If you have an alternate start mod that is fine as long as you do a new game.

You can still use the mod on an existing game but some features will not work. For instance, you will see that you can travel to Riverwood from Riverwood. I have also added new carriage markers at more appropriate locations close to the carriage for immersion when you travel. However, without a new game you will spawn in at the vanilla markers instead of the ones i put in. Neither of these issues break anything, they just don't register properly without a new game. You can still use the mod fine without a new game as long as you don't care about these known issues.

You cannot travel while in combat and you cannot travel while overburdened. That's the way it is in Vanilla and it's the same here.

No need to use Tesedit, this mod is 100% clean with no errors.

If you find any issues let me know so i can try to work them out.[/b]


[color=#a05722]
[size=4]Conflicts[/size][/color]

Will conflict with other mods that add or change carriages.
Can possibly conflict with mods that modify towns or add new buildings.



[color=#a05722][size=4]Load Order[/size][/color]

Doesn't really matter. I would run Loot anyway.



[color=#a05722][size=4]Install/Un-install[/size][/color]

Use Nexus Mod Manger (Recommend).
To manually install, unpack to your data directory located in your steam directory.

To uninstall just reverse.



[color=#b45f06][size=4]Credits
[/size][/color]
Bethesda
Nexus
Janisa, for all the beta testing she has done for me.
Slytra for the video.


[color=#b45f06][size=4]
Check out my other mods.
